      • FileTokenizer

        public FileTokenizer()
        Constructs a FileTokenizer object.

      • FileTokenizer

        public FileTokenizer(java.lang.String filePath)
              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                     java.io.IOException
        Constructs a FileTokenizer and immediately tokenizes the file into a LinkedList stored in this object.
        Parameters:
        filePath - path to the file to be tokenized
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if file not found
        java.io.IOException - if file could not be read

    • Method Detail

      • tokenizeFile

        public void tokenizeFile(java.lang.String filePath)
                  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                         java.io.IOException
        Tokenizes the file into a LinkedList stored in this object.
        Parameters:
        filePath - path to the file to be tokenized
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if file not found
        java.io.IOException - if file could not be read

      • stackReset

        public static void stackReset()
        Resets the stack with an empty list. To be called before calling stackIsBalanced(), stackList(), or stackUpdate().

      • stackIsBalanced

        public static boolean stackIsBalanced()
                               throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns whether or not the stack is balanced.
        Returns:
        true if the stack is balanced
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if stack has not been reset
        See Also:
        stackReset()

      • stackList

        public static java.lang.String stackList()
                                  throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns a string of the contents of the stack.
        Returns:
        true if the stack is balanced
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if stack has not been reset
        See Also:
        stackReset()

      • stackUpdate

        public static void stackUpdate(java.lang.String input)
                        throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Adds an item to that stack and pops off items if they match up to the last scope indicator (e.g. it is the closing '}' to an opening '{').
        Parameters:
        input - the token to push onto the stack
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if stack has not been reset
        See Also:
        stackReset()

      • isCloserForOpener

        public static boolean isCloserForOpener(java.lang.String opener,
                                        java.lang.String closer)
        Returns whether or not the closing token matches an opening token (e.g. it is the closing '}' to an opening '{').
        Parameters:
        opener - the possible opening token
        closer - the possible closing token
        Returns:
        true if items match
